content.$t: image: http://teacheratsea.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/tas1book.jpg?w=200, caption: Teacher at Sea: Miss Cook's Voyage on the Ronald H. Brown, body: The first children's book, "Teacher at Sea: Miss Cook's Voyage on the RONALD H. BROWN", focuses on oceanographic and atmospheric research. It was written by Mary Cook and Diane Stanitski, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 5.15Mb).

gsx$caption.$t: Teacher at Sea: Miss Cook's Voyage on the Ronald H. Brown

gsx$body.$t: The first children's book, "Teacher at Sea: Miss Cook's Voyage on the RONALD H. BROWN", focuses on oceanographic and atmospheric research. It was written by Mary Cook and Diane Stanitski, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 5.15Mb).

content.$t: image: http://teacheratsea.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/tas2book.jpg?w=200, caption: Teacher at Sea: Mrs. Armwood's Hydrographic Adventure on NOAA Ship Fairweather, body: The third children's book, "Teacher at Sea: Mrs. Armwood's Hydrographic Adventure on the NOAA Ship FAIRWEATHER", focuses on hydrographic research. It was written by Diane Stanitski, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 10.41Mb).

gsx$caption.$t: Teacher at Sea: Mrs. Armwood's Hydrographic Adventure on NOAA Ship Fairweather

gsx$body.$t: The third children's book, "Teacher at Sea: Mrs. Armwood's Hydrographic Adventure on the NOAA Ship FAIRWEATHER", focuses on hydrographic research. It was written by Diane Stanitski, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 10.41Mb).

content.$t: image: http://teacheratsea.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/tas3book.jpg?w=200, caption: Teacher at Sea: Mr. Tanenbaum Explores Atlantic Fisheries on the NOAA Ship Henry B. Bigelow, body: The fourth children's book, "Teacher at Sea: Mr. Tanenbaum Explores Atlantic Fisheries on the NOAA Ship Henry B. Bigelow", focuses on North Atlantic fisheries research. It was written by Diane Stanitski and John Adler, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 7.85Mb).

gsx$caption.$t: Teacher at Sea: Mr. Tanenbaum Explores Atlantic Fisheries on the NOAA Ship Henry B. Bigelow

gsx$body.$t: The fourth children's book, "Teacher at Sea: Mr. Tanenbaum Explores Atlantic Fisheries on the NOAA Ship Henry B. Bigelow", focuses on North Atlantic fisheries research. It was written by Diane Stanitski and John Adler, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 7.85Mb).

content.$t: image: http://teacheratsea.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/tiabook.jpg?w=200, caption: Teacher in the Air: Dr. Diane's Flight with the NOAA Hurricane Hunters, body: The second children's book, "Teacher in the Air: Dr. Diane's Flight with the NOAA Hurricane Hunters", focuses on hurricane research. It was written by Diane Stanitski and John Adler, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 4.22Mb).

gsx$caption.$t: Teacher in the Air: Dr. Diane's Flight with the NOAA Hurricane Hunters

gsx$body.$t: The second children's book, "Teacher in the Air: Dr. Diane's Flight with the NOAA Hurricane Hunters", focuses on hurricane research. It was written by Diane Stanitski and John Adler, with illustrations by Bruce Cowden (pdf, 4.22Mb).

content.$t:
image: http://teacheratsea.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/lessons.jpg?w=200, caption: Discovering Our Ocean and Atmosphere with the NOAA Teacher at Sea Book Series, body: Accompanying the four children's books is a unit of lesson plans, "Discovering Our Ocean and Atmosphere with the NOAA Teacher at Sea Book Series". With this PDF you can print the entire unit or only the lessons you need. (pdf, 6.76Mb).

*Please note: An Excel file (46Kb), a PDF on radiosondes (183Kb), and a short movie clip (18.47MB) accompany Lesson 1.

gsx$caption.$t: Discovering Our Ocean and Atmosphere with the NOAA Teacher at Sea Book Series

gsx$body.$t:
Accompanying the four children's books is a unit of lesson plans, "Discovering Our Ocean and Atmosphere with the NOAA Teacher at Sea Book Series". With this PDF you can print the entire unit or only the lessons you need. (pdf, 6.76Mb).

*Please note: An Excel file (46Kb), a PDF on radiosondes (183Kb), and a short movie clip (18.47MB) accompany Lesson 1.
